Welcome to cisipy’s documentation!¶

Preprocessing¶

Stitching¶

cisipy.preprocessing.stitcher.stitch(input_directory, input_filename, output_directory, imagej_instance)¶

Use the BigStitcher plugin to stitch together the series at input_filepath.

See Fuse.ijm for the ImageJ macro code.

Parameters

  • input_directory (Union[str, pathlib.Path]) – Directory in which input microscopy file is located.

  • input_filename (str) – Name of microscopy file (excluding file extension).

  • output_directory (Union[str, pathlib.Path]) – Directory in which to output stitched images,

  • imagej_instance (imagej.ImageJ) – An ImageJ instance.

Returns

A handle on the Java process that is completing the stitching job. This is useful for keeping track of concurrent stitching jobs.

cisipy.preprocessing.stitcher.stitch_all_samples(config, parallelize=0)¶
